Package com.api.hub.ai.cache

Class CacheConfiguration

java.lang.Object
com.api.hub.ai.cache.CacheConfiguration
@Configuration @EnableScheduling public class CacheConfiguration extends Object
Configuration class for cache initialization in the Enterprise AI Agent Execution and Orchestration Platform.

This configuration dynamically registers cache beans based on property-driven conditions. Specifically, it initializes a default in-memory cache implementation for EnvironmentState using SimpleCacheHandler when the property cache.env.simplecache=true is set.

Caching is critical in the platform to maintain low-latency access to environment states and session-specific data during LLM/Non-LLM agent orchestration workflows.

Each chat session in the platform creates a new EnvironmentState instance, uniquely identified by a chat/session ID, which is cached to optimize agent context switching and state management.

Scheduled tasks enabled via @EnableScheduling are utilized internally for refreshing and syncing cache content with potential external systems (if implemented via CacheOperations).

  • Method Details

    • getDefaultEnvCache

      @Bean("EnvironmentStateCache") @ConditionalOnProperty(name="cache.env.simplecache", havingValue="true") public Cache<String,EnvironmentState> getDefaultEnvCache()
      Registers a default in-memory Cache bean for storing EnvironmentState instances, typically used for managing the lifecycle and context of each agent chat session.

      This bean is only activated when the property cache.env.simplecache is explicitly set to true, allowing developers to switch between in-memory and more advanced cache providers (e.g., Redis, NoSQL) without code changes.

      Returns:
      a SimpleCacheHandler instance for managing EnvironmentState
